bundles.name: Basic Bundle
bundles.description: The bare minimum bundle to run an Amplifier agent - just a provider and basic orchestrator. No special tools or capabilities, perfect for simple conversations.
suggestedPrompts: Explain quantum computing in simple terms
Write a haiku about artificial intelligence
What are the key principles of good software design?
Tell me a joke about programming

bundles.name: Chat Bundle
bundles.description: Have a look at the bundle used for the chat functionality on this site! Similar to the basic bundle but with a set of grounding files for context.
suggestedPrompts: How does Amplifier's "mechanism not policy" philosophy actually work in practice?
What's the relationship between amplifier-core, amplifier-foundation, and the CLI/Desktop apps?
How does the bundle composition system work, and how would I create my own custom bundle?
What types of workflows or projects is Amplifier best suited for?
How can I extend Amplifier with custom tools, providers, or agents?

bundles.name: Documentation Bundle
bundles.description: A specialized bundle for technical documentation with filesystem and web research capabilities. Creates clear, comprehensive documentation including READMEs, API docs, and user guides.
suggestedPrompts: Create a comprehensive README for this project
Generate API documentation from the code
Write a user guide for setting up and using this application
Document the architecture and design patterns used in this codebase

bundles.name: Developer Bundle
bundles.description: A comprehensive developer bundle with filesystem, bash, web search, and code analysis tools. Full-stack development capabilities for building, testing, and debugging code.
suggestedPrompts: Read package.json and explain the project dependencies
Create a Python script that analyzes log files for errors
Search the web for best practices in React component testing
Find all TODO comments in this codebase using grep

bundles.name: Code Reviewer Bundle
bundles.description: A specialized bundle for code review with read-only filesystem access and analysis tools. Uses Claude Opus for deep code analysis focused on quality, security, and best practices.
suggestedPrompts: Review this codebase for security vulnerabilities
Analyze the code structure and suggest improvements
Check for any SQL injection or XSS vulnerabilities
Review error handling patterns and suggest best practices

bundles.name: Presentation Creator Bundle
bundles.description: A specialized bundle for creating presentation content with research and file management capabilities. Uses streaming for real-time content generation and includes visual design suggestions.
suggestedPrompts: Create a presentation about the benefits of microservices architecture
Design a sales pitch deck for our new AI product
Generate a technical deep-dive presentation on our system architecture
Build a training presentation on secure coding practices
